pullRequest.body:
This proves that Braided one-side Rigid categories are Rigid.

---

The proof I formalised is at [MO](https://mathoverflow.net/a/162729/493261).

Please help with naming lemmas and theorems, as well as instructing on where to place these things. In particular, I am not sure whether the "ExactPairing X Y => ExactPairing Y X" part *as an instance* would cause infinite loops in the typeclass inferences, and also whether the "BraidedCategory + LeftRigidCategory => RigidCategory" would cause typeclass diamonds.

Also this resolves a TODO item in `FdRep`, namely to prove that `FdRep k G` is a Rigid category. I will remove the item in another PR, since I am working on finishing them all :) Here is verification code:

```lean
import Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monoidal.Rigid.Braided
import Mathlib.Algebra.Category.FGModuleCat.Basic

open CategoryTheory Category

variable (k : Type*) [Field k]

#synth RigidCategory (FGModuleCat k)
```

Update: I changed my mind lol

</details>

---

<details><summary>

</summary>

`+ exactPairing_swap`
`+ hasLeftDualOfHasRightDual`
`+ hasRightDualOfHasLeftDual`
`+ leftRigidCategoryOfRightRigidCategory`
`+ rightRigidCategoryOfLeftRigidCategory`
`+ rigidCategoryOfLeftRigidCategory`

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

`ExactPairing X Y => ExactPairing Y X` should be fine.

General with instance loops or diamonds, be bold. Try things out and if you get into trouble retreat. :-)
I renamed `exactPairing_braided` to `exactPairing_swap` since the definition is already under `CategoryTheory.BraidedCategory` namespace, but I still think it's a bad name :P
I'm happy with this now, but you need to `git merge origin/master` and resolve the merge conflict.
should work now, thanks!

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10456153248/job/28952800110)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10458124494/job/28959230019)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10458124494/job/28959230616)
Thank you!

```suggestion
/-- coevaluation_evaluation' field of ExactPairing Y X in a braided category -/
```

```suggestion
/- coevaluation_evaluation' field of `ExactPairing Y X` in a braided category -/
```
I'd ident a bit more (perhaps even 6 more spaces)
Increase indent here by two, since it's a line wrap of the term above.
Non-terminal `simp` isn't allowed!
Are you sure these don't compress into a single `simpa [...] using ...`?

I can't get it to work. TLDR the `yang_baxter` says $f_1 \gg f_2 \gg f_3 = f_4 \gg f_5 \gg f_6$, while I have $f_1^{-1} \gg f_4 = f_2 \gg f_4 \gg f_6^{-1} \gg f_5^{-1}$. Actually the $\gg$ isn't even just pure $\gg$, but the $\otimes \gg$ in Lean notation, so `rw` or `simp` isn't smart enough to rewrite (especially with associativity stuff)

```suggestion
variable {C : Type*} [Category C] [MonoidalCategory C] [BraidedCategory C] {X Y : C}
```
since you don't need to mention the universe below, there's no need to even name it.
I thought adding universes speed up universe unification? Or does it not make a difference here

It doesn't make a difference here. Also `Type*` under the hood does add universes! It's `Type _` which potentially results in universe unification problems (that can take time, and give unexpected results).
Don't like the title. "braiding equivalence" is referring to a braiding-preserving equivalence of categories, which is not what you mean here.

Also what is "mirror"? Without reading the file below I don't think anyone would guess. The module doc should be interpretable in isolation. The module doc in particular should include `ExactPairing Y X` somewhere in the text!
I have made an edit, do you mind seeing if it is better? I am really bad at naming things
Looks good, thanks.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory): Braided one-side Rigid categories are (two-side) Rigid
